import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.aea6db93:
# importing datetime
from datetime import date
source.d9de5d7b:
#Transform string to date of format "%Y-%m-%d"
data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data.date,format="%Y-%m-%d")

#Extracting Year from date
data['year'] = data.date.dt.year

#Extracting Month from date
data['month'] = data.date.dt.month
source.b45f085e:
#Extracting passed years since the current date
#can be seen as difference of today's year and the year given in date column
data['passed_years'] = date.today().year - data.date.dt.year
source.e8e0c230:
#Extracting passed months since the current date
#can be seen as difference of today's year & month and the year & month  given in date column
data['passed_months'] = (data.passed_years)*12 + date.today().month - data.date.dt.month
source.7cb64b54:
#Extracting the weekday name from date
data['day_name'] = data.date.dt.day_name()
source.2f79d960:
# Lets check data head for your engineered features
data[['date','year','month','passed_years','passed_months','day_name']].head()
source.2421b35a:
#checking count of each day in dataset
data[['day_name']].value_counts()
source.4659447a:
#  8. Date and Time Engineering
Three types of preprocessing for dates:
* Extracting the parts of the date into different columns: `Year, month, day` 
* Extracting the time period between current date and columns in terms of `years, months, days`
* Extracting some specific features from the date: `Name of weekday, Weekend or not, holiday or not`
